ApiKey.description: This security scheme requires an API Key to successfully authenticate.
ApiKey.name: X-Api-Key

ReturnURL.description: The URL to which the user is redirected at the end of the Hosted Checkout session. We will include the CheckoutSessionID, ExternalID and Status of the session, ie `?CheckoutSessionID={CheckoutSessionID}&ExternalID={ExternalID}&Status={Status}`

Calculated.description: Calculated price information. Not returned if amount is not provided in the query.

Limits.description: Limits for the channel in requested currency.

Rate.description: Rate used for the cryptocurrency being exchanged against the channel fiat currency. Does not include fees. It is not a quoted price and is subject to market fluctuations.

PaymentMethods.description: Recent payment methods for the channel. Only returned if `CustomerID` was provided in the query.

ProcessingSeconds.description: The time it takes to process a transaction through the channel

FormSchema.description: Form schema which needs to be filled by the customer. If a PaymentMethodID was provided, only the missing fields are displayed in the schema.

TotalFee.description: The total fee that will be charged for using the specific channel, always specified in the same currency as the requested fiat segment of the transaction.

MinLimit.description: The minimum amount that can be sent through the channel

MaxLimit.description: The maximum amount that can be sent through the channel

Total.description: Amount including outflows that have not yet settled.

ExternalID.description: A unique identifier used in the business system to store a reference for the transaction. This field allows businesses to track and manage transactions within their internal systems.

PaymentMethodID.description: Existing payment method id to be used.

DestinationAddress.description: The destination address to which the crypto currency should be transferred.

PaymentMethodDisplayDetails.description: Contains information to display each payment method, with fields tailored to the specific type (e.g., last four digits or account number) to help identify the payment method.

TotalFee.description: The total fee that will be charged for using the specific channel, always specified in the same currency as the requested fiat segment of the transaction.

BusinessFee.description: The fee applied on behalf of the business to customer transactions, always specified in the same currency as the requested fiat segment of the transaction.

CryptoFeeBreakdown.description: Total fee amount breakdown in cryptocurrency.

FeeBreakdownItemType.description:
What fee the items refers to:
* ChannelFee
* BusinessFee

FiatAmount.description: Amount sent to customer's payment method.

DelayedSell.description: When enabled, balance checks are deferred until the final sell request, allowing the order to be prepared now and executed later.

FiatAmount.description: Amount sent to customer's payment method.

CryptoAuthorizedAmount.description: Maximum amount that can be charged for this transaction.

DestinationAddress.description: The final destination address to which the crypto currency should be transferred.

Permanent.description: If True, a rule can be executed repeatedly. Default is False.

FormSchema.description: Form schema which needs to be filled by the customer. If no customer input is required, this field is omitted.

FormInput.description: Form input to be submitted based on returned FormSchema

FormSessionID.description: Unique identifier for the Form Session. Form Session allows ramping using provided form data.

TotalFee.description: The total fee that will be charged for using the specific channel, always specified in the same currency as the requested fiat segment of the transaction.

CryptoAmountEstimate.description: The estimated amount of cryptocurrency that will be used in this transaction.

CryptoAuthorizedAmount.description: Maximum amount that can be charged for this transaction. This will be used in your subsequent `/transactions/sell` request

FiatCurrencyCode.description: Supported fiat ISO_4217 3 letter currency codes.

AssetID.description: A scalar representing a financial asset code. Suitable for use in cases where exactly one of the currency codes must be provided.

TransactionDirection.description: Whether the transactions was a credit (in) or a debit (out) in your account

Network.description:
Payments network (main/sandbox):
 * Bitcoin/BitcoinTest
 * Lightning/LightningTest
 * Ethereum/EthereumTestSepolia
 * PolygonPos/PolygonTestAmoy
 * Solana/SolanaDevnet
 * OffNetwork/OffNetwork

Nonce.description: A string which must be unique each time a new transaction is created, like a UUID or operation sequence number. Request can be idempotently retried by using the same Nonce.

PaymentMethodCategory.description:
Categorizes one or more `PaymentMethodType`s into broader groups. Useful for listing channels, displaying payment methods:
 * Bank
 * Card
 * Identifier

PaymentMethodType.description:
Specific type of payment method:
 * BankSepa
 * BankLocal
 * BankFedwire
 * TokenizedCard
 * IdentifierPix

DestinationAddress.description: A destination address to transfer cryptocurrency

ID.description: NOAH's unique identifier for the transaction.

PublicID.description: The public blockchain transaction id or hash. This identifier is only available for transactions that are broadcast to a public network as well as some private networks where available, e.g. Lightning

Amount.description: The net crypto amount transacted, affecting the balance. This amount **excludes** the `NetworkFee`. For buy transactions, this is the amount after payment fees. For sell transactions, this is the amount before payment fees.

NetworkFee.description: Amount paid to cover the the onchain network or gas fee associated with the transaction, if applicable.

FiatPayment.description:
* For buy transactions, `Transaction.Amount = (FiatPayment.Amount - FiatPayment.FeeAmount) / FiatPayment.Rate`
 * For sell transactions, `Transaction.Amount = (FiatPayment.Amount + FiatPayment.FeeAmount) / FiatPayment.Rate`

FiatPaymentMethod.description: Information about the fiat payment method used to facilitate this transaction.

Breakdown.description: This list explains how the transaction amount was calculated.

TransactionBreakdownType.description:
What does the breakdown item amount refer to:
* ChannelFee: amount withheld by the system from the fiat payment
* BusinessFee: amount to withheld on behalf of the business over its customers transactions
* Remaining: amount withheld by the system from the fiat payment

Amount.description: The final amount that has been debited (for buy transactions) or credited (for sell transactions) from the payment method.

FeeAmount.description: The fee applied to this payment.

FiatCurrency.description: The currency related to the amounts.

FiatDepositID.description: The ID of the deposit when the payment originated from a deposit.

IDType.description:
Type of identification document:
 * DrivingLicense
 * NationalIDCard
 * Passport
 * AddressProof
 * ResidencePermit
 * TaxID

Street.description: Street: the primary name of an address's street.

Street2.description: Street2: the secondary name of an address's street.

City.description: City: name of an address's city or town.

State.description: State: the address's state / province / county. For USA and Canada, state code in ISO 3166-2 code (e.g. CA) is required.

IssuingCountry.description: Issuing country of the identity, ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

ErrorType.description:
Type of error:
* InvalidMessage
* Unexpected
* ResourceNotFound
* Unauthorized
* Forbidden
* InsufficientBalance

Instance.description: A unique reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

Action.description: Action taking place which resulted in error.

ErrorExtensionFeatures.description: Details about the disabled feature flags

items.description:
Type of reason:
* BetaAccess
* GloballyDisabled
* Maintenance
* RestrictedRegion
* Kyc
* Suspended

CustomerID.description: A unique ID which identifies the customer in the Business' internal system and in NOAH.

HostedURL.description: Hosted URL to redirect the user to fulfil the payment.

AuthorizedAmount.description: Maximum amount that can be charged for this transaction.

Status.description:
Status of CheckoutSession:
* Pending
* Failed
* Settled

Note: other statuses could be added in the future

HostedURL.description: Hosted URL to redirect the user to manage their payment methods.

Quantity.description: Quantity of the line item. Must be greater than zero.

UnitAmount.description: Amount of a single unit of the line item. Must be in the same currency as the transaction.

TotalAmount.description: Total amount of the line item (UnitAmount * Quantity). Must be in the same currency as the transaction.

EventType.description:
Type of the event being sent:
 * Transaction
 * FiatDeposit
 * CheckoutSession

StepDecimal.description: Select a fixed amount, an input or a decimal operation with the two

Operations.description: Operations are applied to `StepDecimal.Value` in the order they appear in the array.

ComparisonOperator.description:
Comparison operator for the field value:
 * EQ (Equals)
 * LTEQ (Less Than Or Equals)
 * GTEQ (Greater Than Or Equals)

RefundAddress.description: Address for refunds in case actions were not executed successfully.

DepositAddress.description: Address generated for the deposit trigger.

RefundAddress.description: Address for refunds in case actions were not executed successfully.

DepositAddress.description: Address generated for the deposit trigger.

SourceAddress.description: Address in depositor's custody from which the deposit was made.
Address in depositor's custody from which the deposit was made.

CryptoAuthorizedAmount.description: Maximum amount that can be charged for this transaction.

FiatAmount.description: Amount sent to customer's payment method.

RuleID.description: Unique identifier for the rule that is matched for the transaction.

RuleExecutionID.description: Unique identifier for the execution of the rules that is matched for the transaction.

ID.description: Unique identifier of the fiat deposit.

Created.description: When was this fiat deposit created.

PaymentMethodID.description: Identifier of the payment method that received the deposit.

Refunds.description: Fiat deposit refunds if any exists

FiatDeposit.description: Details of a fiat deposit received by NOAH.

post.description: Send a callback to the specified URL when the payment status updates.

parameters.name: Webhook-Signature
parameters.description: Digital signature generated by the sender

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

get.description: Retrieve all balances for the Business User's account.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

post.description: Create a rule used to create automated responses to events.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

get.description:
This endpoint provides a [JSONForm](https://jsonforms.io/) schema needed to configure payment methods for transactions on a specified channel. Use this schema to dynamically generate forms based on the selected payment method. The `ChannelID` parameter, obtainable from the Supported Channels endpoint, specifies the target channel for which the form is generated.

**Note:** It is not possible to fetch schemas for channels where the `PaymentMethodType` is set to `TokenizedCard`, as the API does not directly accept credit card details. For credit card payments, please refer to the [Hosted Checkout](../hosted-checkout/introduction) solution.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

get.description: List of supported channels for selling crypto into fiat.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

get.description: Retrieve a complete list of countries where sell operations are supported. The response is useful for enabling customers to select their desired Country+FiatCurrency combination for receiving payouts. After making a selection, obtain the channels for the chosen Country+FiatCurrency using `GET /channels/sell`

HostedURL.description: URL to redirect the customer to the checkout page.

post.description: Accept a crypto payment for a checkout session.

CustomerID.description: Identifies the customer in user's system

LineItems.description: List of line items that your customer is purchasing using this Hosted Checkout Session. This is used for display purposes for the customer during Checkout as well as remediation of disputed payments. We do not make any calculations using this data.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

post.description:
Create a Hosted Checkout session to enable a customer to onramp to your platform using the NOAH Hosted Checkout page.

 If the `Customer` object is provided, the customer will be upserted. If the `Customer` object is not provided, the `CustomerID` should refer to an existing customer.

CustomerID.description: Identifies the customer in business' system

LineItems.description: List of line items that your customer is purchasing using this Hosted Checkout Session. This is used for display purposes for the customer during Checkout as well as remediation of disputed payments. We do not make any calculations using this data.

200.description: Checkout manage response includes a link to redirect the user.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

post.description:
Create a session that allows the customer to create, update or delete their payment methods. 

 If the `Customer` object is provided, the customer will be upserted. If the `Customer` object is not provided, the `CustomerID` should refer to an existing customer.

LineItems.description: List of line items that your customer is selling using this Hosted Checkout Session. This is used for display purposes for the customer during Checkout as well as remediation of disputed payments.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

get.description: Retrieve paginated customers for your account.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

put.description: Creates or updates a customer record. A unique `CustomerID` must be provided, as the API does not generate this identifier. For consistency, it is recommended to use the customer ID from your internal system as the `CustomerID`. This customer record must exist before executing any operations that depend on the `CustomerID`.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific customer by their CustomerID.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

get.description: Retrieves a list of payment methods for a specific customer.

parameters.name: SourceAmount
parameters.description: Only one of `SourceAmount` or `DestinationAmount` can be defined. When this amount is specified, the response `DestinationAmount` field indicates how much you will get for this, after the deduction of any fees.

parameters.name: DestinationAmount
parameters.description: Only one of `SourceAmount` or `DestinationAmount` can be defined. When this amount is specified, the response `SourceAmount` field indicates how much you will need to sell to get this and cover any fees.

200.description: Price estimate successful. Response includes the rate of currency exchange before and after fees are subtracted.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

get.description: Allows you to retrieve real-time information about a conversion between two supported currencies, including the rate before and after the NOAH Fee is applied. During a NOAH Hosted Checkout session, real-time /prices data is used to calculate the fees and thus the final amount a customer will pay. In case neither SourceAmount or DestinationAmount is defined the fee is not available.

401.description: Client is not authorized to perform this action

Only available in sandbox environment.
A fiat deposit will be created towards a fiat payment method. This could trigger webhooks, worklows or rules that you have previously setup.

post.description: Initiate a transaction to sell the specified cryptocurrency and send the requested fiat currency to the specified payout method. Allows for sending form data to submit a payment method.

post.description: Calculates the inputs required for the Sell endpoint, intended to be used as a preliminary step for validating transaction details before execution. This allows the business to review estimated fees and limits prior to initiating the actual sell transaction.

This endpoint sets up workflow which automatically converts fiat currency from bank deposits into cryptocurrency and sends the acquired crypto to the specified wallet address on the specified network. The workflow will be triggered automatically and indefinitely whenever a bank transfer is made to the bank account described in the response. The deposited amount will be traded for the specified cryptocurrency at the current market price after application of fees.
 **Important**: 
 * On-chain operations are irreversible
 * Market prices may fluctuate significantly, impacting the final amount of cryptocurrency sent
 * Although this endpoint should return the same bank details for the same customer we can't guarantee the longevity of those details. For this reason, every time you need to present the customer with the bank deposit details, you should use this endpoint to get them. If the customer reuses the bank details after they become invalid the transfer will fail and money will NOT be lost.

info.title: NOAH Business API
info.description:
The NOAH Business API is organised around REST, using resource-oriented URLs. It accepts JSON-encoded request bodies and returns JSON-encoded responses. All our endpoints follow REST conventions and use standard HTTP response codes, authentication and methods.

Please follow the links in the navigation to find out more about each resource and endpoint.

Our full OpenApi v3 Schema can be exported using the button above.
